revised_title: The Role of Phosphate and Oxalate of Lime in Cell Formation and Disease
tldr: This paper explores the importance of phosphate and oxalate of lime in cell formation and their relation to diseases. The author, William Beneke, demonstrates that phosphate of lime is necessary for cell formation in humans, animals, and plants. He also discusses the role of oxalic acid in the body and its connection to diseases, as well as the effects of various factors, such as diet and oxygen intake, on the production of oxalic acid.
